summary.title: Professional Summary
summary.text: Ph.D. in Computer Science with over 5 years of experience designing and implementing advanced NLP and Generative AI solutions. Proven expertise in building full-stack RAG systems for complex data environments. Passionate about leveraging cutting-edge AI to solve real-world business problems and drive innovation.

jobs.title: Lead AI Engineer
description: Architected and deployed end-to-end RAG systems for enterprise clients in the financial and legal sectors.
Led a team of 5 engineers in developing production-level NLP models, improving model inference time by 40%.
Managed the full MLOps lifecycle from data ingestion and model training to deployment and monitoring.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Developed document processing systems using NLP and computer vision to automate data extraction from unstructured documents.
Optimized and deployed object detection models (YOLOv4) on edge devices for real-time analysis.

items.name: Financial Document Analysis Platform (Professional)
items.description: Architected an end-to-end system for processing legal banking documents with a multi-lingual OCR pipeline. The system reduced manual data entry by 90% and improved data extraction accuracy by 30%.

items.name: Academic Research RAG System (PhD Research)
items.description: Developed a full-stack RAG system to analyze and query over 500 research papers, utilizing open-source models and a custom vector database implementation to facilitate novel literature reviews.

degrees.thesis_title: Thesis: 'Advanced Methods for Knowledge Retrieval in Large Language Models'

publications.title: Publications
items: Doe, J., et al. (2023). 'A Novel Approach to Skill Assessment in Complex Simulations.' Journal of AI Research.
Smith, A., & Doe, J. (2021). 'Haptic Technology in Virtual Training Environments.' Frontiers in Robotics and AI.

teaching.title: Teaching, Leadership & Certifications
items: Teaching Assistant for Advanced AI, University of Technology (2020-2023).
Lead, Graduate Research Group on NLP (2022-2023).
